intro: Mabea piriri var. laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf mabea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
